title: 110_hr3948
content: The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" establishes a temporary Iraq War surtax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This surtax is aimed at funding the costs associated with the Iraq War. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax in 2008, increasing tax liability for joint returns to fund the costs of the war. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax in 2008 based on net income tax liability tiers: 2.5% up to $10,600, $265 plus 5% from $10,600 to $22,600, $865 plus 11% from $22,600 to $36,400, and $2,383 plus 16% over $36,400. The tax rates under the "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" increase based on net income tax liability tiers, with rates of 11% for income over $22,600 and 16% for income over $36,400 for individuals, trusts, and estates. The surtax rates under the "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" are based on net income tax liability tiers. The rates range from 2.5% for income not over $5,300 to 16% for income over $18,200. The tax imposed on corporations with net income tax liability under the "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" is increased by 16%. Certain exceptions related to military service apply to individuals. The tax liability for corporations is increased by 16 percent under the "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007." Certain exceptions related to military service apply to individuals, excluding members of the Armed Forces who received excludible compensation during specific taxable years. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" increases corporate tax liability by 16 percent. Exceptions apply to individuals, excluding members of the Armed Forces who received specific compensation during taxable years. The United States Code provides exceptions for decedents who died on or after September 11, 2001, and before the close of the taxable year. Joint returns are treated based on the description of either spouse. An exception based on adjusted gross income is also included. The taxpayer's treatment is based on the description of either spouse. An exception applies if the taxpayer's adjusted gross income is not over $30,000. Net income tax liability is defined as the excess of regular tax liability and tax imposed by section 55, minus certain credits. The term 'net income tax liability' is defined as the excess of regular tax liability and tax imposed by section 55, minus certain credits. Part VIII. Temporary Iraq War Surtax. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. The amendment made by subsection (a) is not considered a change in a rate of tax for purposes of section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
